notes: Closely related decomposition prompting is well studied; exact label less often isolated.
Related self-explanation/teaching-style prompting exists; exact "teach then answer" setup less standardized.
Confidence/calibration is widely studied in LLMs; direct accuracy gains are mixed.
Little direct isolation of "same content, multiple formats" as primary intervention.
Mostly conceptual; limited direct controlled LLM studies isolating this factor.
Strong human-learning evidence; limited direct LLM testing as a standalone intervention.
Analogical prompting exists, but effects are task-dependent and not uniformly benchmarked.
LLM analogue (high-confidence wrong -> correction gain) is not well established.
Related generate-then-solve patterns exist; strict PF framing rarely isolated.
Strong cognitive theory; limited direct LLM evidence of prompt-strategy-by-difficulty reversal effects.
